meanings.definition: To release or remove a substance from a surface through desorption.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the chemical desorbing from the metal surface.
meanings.sent2: After the experiment, the molecules started desorbing from the glass slide.
meanings.sent3: The tiny particles seemed to be playing hide-and-seek, desorbing from the paper.
meanings.sent4: The memories lingered on the walls like echoes, slowly desorbing into the air.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the water, desorbing its shimmering reflections.

meanings.definition: The act of desorbing a substance from a surface.
meanings.sent1: The desorbing of the paint revealed the original color of the wall.
meanings.sent2: The technician carefully monitored the desorbing process of the chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The sudden desorbing of the aroma from the kitchen caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The desorbing of the fog from the mountains unveiled a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The gradual desorbing of the ink created intricate patterns on the paper.
